organizations: New York Society for the Suppression of Vice

relationships.description: Friends and collaborators - Krassner was Bruce's editor and friend
Multiple arrests and legal conflicts over obscenity charges
Bruce faced opposition from Catholic authorities for his material

analysis.purpose: To commemorate Lenny Bruce's legacy and critique censorship and political systems
analysis.significance: Documents the persecution of a groundbreaking comedian and draws parallels to contemporary political issues

notable_quotes: "In the Halls of Justice, the only justice is in the halls."
"Ignoring the mandate of Franklin D. Roosevelt is a great deal more offensive than saying Eleanor has lovely nay-nays."
red_flags: Police breaking candy bars looking for drugs
Suspension of liquor license without cause

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion in this document

illegal_activity.description: Document discusses historical legal cases and political commentary, but contains no first-hand illegal activity

details: Press conference cancellation due to death threats

public_knowledge.context: Lenny Bruce's legal battles are well-documented historical events. The 2016 election results and controversies are publicly known information.

analysis.summary: This article commemorates the 50th anniversary of comedian Lenny Bruce's death, detailing his legal battles over obscenity charges, his innovative comedy style, and the author's personal experiences with him. The piece draws parallels between Bruce's persecution by authorities and contemporary political issues, ending with a sharp critique of the 2016 election results.
